entries.meaning: (of a political region, geographical terrain, road, etc.) Unsuitable for or hostile to travel; incapable of being journeyed over or upon.
examples: By encreasing the hollowness of a wide carriage road, much beyond the utility of form, the margins might no doubt be brought into a travellable state; whereas, of a flat road, in a wet season, every part, from side to side becomes equally untravellable.
. . . the defendant to have the right to reject 1000 sheep from the number mustered, which were to include lame or untravellable sheep.
